text: today's recipe could not be easier and I
am not exaggerating it's a beef stew and
you don't even need to brown it yeah you

wanted to to add an extra step and
potentially more flavor but this one is
really good and it's enriched with some
tomato paste and some balsamic vinegar
and that really amps up the flavor and
so maybe you're not even gonna miss the
Browning give it a try and let me know
cut two onions about 1 pound into sort
of largest chunks everything's just
gonna go right into a pot and in fact if
you wanted to you could make this in a
slow cooker mm-hmm like slow cookers
right I know you do don't tell me you
don't I know you do it's a lot but it's
3 pounds of beef Chuck so you want to
offset that with some other flavors
right so it's a pound of onion a pound
of carrot and a pound of potato in
addition to 3 pounds of beef 6 cloves of
garlic those just need to be smashed you
don't even need to cut them up just put
the flat side of your knife on and press
down be careful though when you're doing
this that your hand doesn't slip okay
then your 1 pound of carrots so these
are peeled cut them into one-and-a-half
inch lengths and at the very end if
they're super thick you can cut those in
half really depends on how big your
carrots are as to whether or not they
need to be trimmed at the end it's gonna
cook for a nice long time so the carrots
need to be sturdy enough to hold up to
that then a pound of new potatoes they
should be scrubbed but not peeled and
halved if they're large 2 bay leaves and
all that is just going to go right into
the pot with your beef before you add
your vegetables to the beef what you
want to do is add 1/3 of a cup of tomato
paste I'm a huge fan of using tomato
paste in these tubes usually if I'm
doing smaller amounts because for bigger
amounts it's actually a little bit
annoying but the cans are fine when
you're using a lot like this but if
you're using a small amount you can just
put this right back into the
refrigerator and you don't have to worry
about trans
bring it to another container like you
do if you're using a can add that
directly to your meat three tablespoons
of balsamic vinegar this beef stew
doesn't even use any broth it just uses
water in combination with the tomato
paste and the balsamic vinegar which is
really quite interesting and then do
tablespoons of all-purpose flour this
will thicken your stew as it cooks I
like to stir that around first get the
beef coated and then you can add your
vegetables the carrots onions garlic and
the bay leaf all go right in 3 cups of
water some salt and pepper gosh guys
couldn't be easier than that right turn
it on and you want to bring this to a
boil on top of the stove that will
assure that it's firmly in the cooking
zone cover it up transfer it to a 350
degree oven and then cook it until
everything is tender 2 to 2 and a half
hours mmm everything looks nice and
reduced and thickened here's the one
thing I'm going to warn you about
remember that this was in the oven so
